main_definition: To complete or bring to an end; accomplish a task, activity, or period of time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reach the conclusion or last stage of something.
meanings_and_examples.example: I finally finished reading that book I've been putting off for weeks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To complete a task, activity, or process.
meanings_and_examples.example: Please finish your homework before going out to play.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To consume all the contents of something, such as food or drink.
meanings_and_examples.example: He finished his glass of milk in one gulp.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To complete a race or competition by reaching the end line before others.
meanings_and_examples.example: She managed to finish first in her swimming race.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To complete a construction project, such as building a house or bridge.
meanings_and_examples.example: The workers finished constructing the new office building on time.
